column5: I have a friend that has two manual big jon down riggers he wants to sell to me. My question is can I add a line counter to them somehow?
If you have line counter reels,  and your running 30 ft leads,   When you get to 100 ft of line out your roughly down 70 ft.

My first riggers were invaders with broken counters, we measured how long each turn was (2.5ft) and counted turns to the desired depth. Tedious at times but it worked. I tried to find counters for them but with no luck. Hope this helps.
Hard to say without looking at the rigger, all depends on the model, on most models you can add a counter Can you get some pictures ? specially from the top, between the handle and pully,
If not, you can try colouring your down rigger cable the way lead core is coloured.  That will give you a good estimate of how much line is out.
Shouldn't be very hard to add a counter, although not an ideal setup.... What happened to the counters that were on them originally?
